user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_create_response_from_buffer_copy:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN struct MHD_Response *
MHD_create_response_from_buffer_copy (size_t size,
                                      const void *buffer)
{
  struct MHD_Response *r;
  void *mhd_copy;

  if (0 == size)
    return MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls (0,
                                                                   NULL,
                                                                   NULL,
                                                                   NULL);
  if (NULL == buffer)
    return NULL;

  mhd_copy = malloc (size);
  if (NULL == mhd_copy)
    return NULL;
  memcpy (mhd_copy, buffer, size);

  r = MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls (size,
                                                              mhd_copy,
                                                              &free,
                                                              mhd_copy);
  if (NULL == r)
    free (mhd_copy);
  else
  {
    /* TODO: remove the next assignment, the buffer should not be modifiable */
    r->data_buffer_size = size;
  }

  return r;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: Fragments not listed (variable declarations, the final "return r;" and simple assignments) are straightforward and do not contain conditional constructs or calls whose behavior could render subsequent statements unreachable. The selected fragments cover all conditional branches and calls to external functions or allocation routines where reachability depends on runtime conditions (size value, buffer pointer, malloc success, and the return value of the external MHD_create_response_from_buffer_with_free_callback_cls). These are the points that must be investigated to determine whether any code paths are actually unreachable; other parts of the function do not present reachability concerns and therefore do not need investigation.
